results.title: My best friends wedding. Steel magnolias
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Rastar Films, Jerry Zucker, Ronald Bass, Ray Stark, P.J. Hogan and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: My best friend’s wedding (103 mins) stars Julia Roberts as the lovelorn food critic Julianne, who discovers she wants to spend the rest of her life with her best friend the day he pops the question to someone else. She has four days to break up the wedding and help her best friend discover that she’s the one. With an outstanding supporting cast including Cameron Diaz and Rupert Everett, this film takes the cake as the romantic comedy of the year. In “Steel Magnolias” (112 mins), six strong Southern belles enjoy a friendship that spans the boundaries of age and status. Despite their differences they share each other’s strength, hope and loyalty to survive the cycles of life, birth, and death to emerge stronger, closer and still laughing. An ensemble cast including Julia Roberts, Sally Field, Olympia Dukakis, Dolly Parton, Shirley MacLaine and Darryl Hannah make this heartrending story, based on the stage play of the same name by Robert Harling, a bittersweet sentimental journey through the lives of this group of truly remarkable women.

results.title: My belle
results.brief_description: An impressionistic portrait of Michelle, a performer preparing for her act, caught between private and public worlds. Made with the assistance of the Creative Development Branch of the Australian Film Commission. Music by Bill Mcdonald and featuring Michelle Tozer. No spoken word.

results.title: My bed, your bed
results.brief_description: In an isolated community, a man and woman are promised under the traditional laws of marriage. The time has come for Delia and Alvin to move in together. Things don’t turn out as smoothly as they might. My Bed, Your Bed explores notions of Aboriginal identity through an examination of the ways that Aboriginal people living in Central Australian bush communities adopt values from both contemporary and traditional works.

results.title: My beautiful shwesters
results.creator_credit: Adam Barolsky, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Adam Barolsky laments the distance he has put between himself and his sisters to find a better life. He tells a tale of deep sorrow and concern for the welfare of the family he has left behind. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia.

results.title: My Beautiful laundrette [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Working Title Films, SAF Productions, Channel Four, Tim Bevan, Sarah Radclyffe and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Contemporary South London, with its mixture of races, classes and subcultures is the setting for this engaging film written by Hanif Kureishi. Omar is a young Anglo-Asian man on the make who is taken under the wing of his materialistic, and benevolently corrupt, Uncle Nasser. Omar is given a rundown laundromat to manage and he enlists an old school friend, Johnny, who has joined the National Front out of boredom, to help him run the business. Omar and Johnny begin a sexual relationship while around them friends and family try to get by as best they can in the divided society of Thatcherite Britain. One of the most joyous and insightful English films of the eighties. Cast includes Daniel Day Lewis, Saeed Jaffrey and Roshan Seth.

results.title: My beach
results.creator_credit: Richard Sagigi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Life, for Richard Sagigi, was never always easy. Times at school when he was getting into trouble forced him to move to another school. But he knows that he can reconnect with himself on the beach where his family live, digging for turtle eggs, learning about animal conservation and meeting people from different cultures.

results.title: My Banquet...
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chey Scovell
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Chey Scovell recounts his childhood growing up as an Australian born in Malaysia and the last four years of schooling spent in Papua New Guinea. He tells of the culture shock he experienced when returning back to Australia.

results.title: My art is me (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A view of children in an experimental nursery school program. Shows them painting, drawing, sewing, mixing playdough, manipulating clay, and constructing wood and scrap sculpture. Explains to teachers the benefits of encouraging creativity rather than providing assignments.
